thread.title: Starbucks Slammed For Shifting To Biodegradable Cups In US: 'Drips Like Sieves'
thread.title_full: Starbucks Slammed For Shifting To Biodegradable Cups In US: 'Drips Like Sieves'

author: @TIMESNOW
title: Starbucks Slammed For Shifting To Biodegradable Cups In US: 'Drips Like Sieves'
text:
Starbucks Slammed For Shifting To Biodegradable Cups In US: 'Drips Like Sieves'
Starbucks' announcement that they will start a new campaign to use biodegradable cups—discontinuing the use of their iconic plastic cup for cold drinks—has angered customers. The new cups are constructed of fiber-based paper with a bioplastic inside, and they look like the ones used for hot beverages.
Starbucks (Photo Credits: X / Twitter)
Starbucks' announcement that they will start a new campaign to use biodegradable cups—discontinuing the use of their iconic plastic cup for cold drinks—has angered customers. The new cups are constructed of fiber-based paper with a bioplastic inside, and they look like the ones used for hot beverages.
However, Starbucks customers are not happy with the change; one recent customer said on Reddit that they were perplexed.
Customers Criticize The
CoffeeChain"The look of that is upsetting," one commenter wrote on Reddit after seeing the new sustainable cups.
Multiple customers also took to X to criticize the beverage company's new move.
One user on X said, "Starbucks
your new cups are horrible- you can’t see your drink, which is part of the fun. And the kids are terrible. Change back! Thank you for bringing back straws and sugar but now terrible new cups."
Another person commented, "So I actually think we should prob figure out how to use less plastic. These are the new “compostable” cups that Starbucks is rolling out . They are for ALL the drinks: hot/cold/blended. I HATE IT."
"Starbucks one of these is an iced tea annd the other an hot coffee. this is the new cup top for hot drinks. Disgusting looking after only a couple sips. It drips like a sieves. You get an F," wrote a third person.
"I’ve never missed that little indent in the top more. Might actually have to start bringing my own cup," added a fourth person.
These opaque white biodegradable cups have replaced the coffee chain's clear single-use plastic to-go cups in 14 states, according to a Starbucks spokesperson. California, Washington, Hawaii, Minnesota, Arizona, New Mexico, Massachusetts, Michigan, Maryland, Connecticut, Virginia, South Carolina, Colorado, and Georgia are among the states that will begin to get the new cups.
